definition: The basic structural and functional unit of all living organisms.
A group of similar cells that perform a specific function.
A structure made up of different tissues that work together to perform a specific function.
An individual living entity that can function on its own.
The process by which living organisms maintain a stable internal environment.
The sum of all chemical reactions that occur within a living organism.
The process by which a parent cell divides into two or more daughter cells.
A structure made of DNA and proteins that contains genetic information.
A segment of DNA that contains the instructions for making a specific protein.
A molecule made up of amino acids that performs various functions in the body.
